description: Hancock demonstrates her mastery of Armament Haki by using it to strike Smoker, a Logia-type Devil Fruit user. This allows her to make physical contact with his normally intangible smoke body and send him flying with a powerful kick.
firstUseContext: Hancock uses Armament Haki when she furiously intervenes to save Luffy from Smoker at Marineford. She coats her leg with Haki to kick Smoker away, demonstrating how this technique can counter Logia intangibility.

description: A powerful kick technique where Hancock strikes her opponent with her leg. When combined with Armament Haki, it becomes even more devastating and can affect Logia users.
firstUseContext: Used against Smoker at Marineford, enhanced with Armament Haki to strike his Logia body.

description: Smoker transforms his fist into smoke and launches it at his opponent with tremendous force. The smoke-enhanced punch can strike from a distance.
firstUseContext: Used against Luffy during their battle at Marineford.

description: A martial art practiced by fish-men that manipulates water to attack opponents. Jinbe, as a master of this art, can deliver devastating strikes that affect even powerful opponents.
firstUseContext: Used to quickly defeat Gecko Moria when Moria attempted to attack Luffy at Marineford.

description: Ivankov's signature technique where they wink with tremendous force, creating a massive shockwave that can blow away enemies or destroy obstacles.
firstUseContext: Used against Marine soldiers during the Marineford battle.

description: A unique martial art style developed by Emporio Ivankov, described as the ultimate form of fighting from the Kamabakka Kingdom. It combines ballet-like movements with devastating attacks.
firstUseContext: Used by Ivankov and the Newkama army while fighting Marines at Marineford.
